docs.text: every now and then , reviewers are faced with the films that are hard to be properly reviewed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of the time it happens with films that leave so overwhelming impact , either good or bad , that in the end reviewers must work hard to express his thoughts or feelings .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but , sometimes it can happen for rather trivial reasons .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i love trouble happened to be one of such occasions for the author of this review .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the impression left by the film wasn't overwhelming - on the contrary , there were hardly any impression at all , since i had real trouble keeping myself awake while watching it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: which surprise me to this day , because the movie theatre was full , i was close to sound speakers , the show wasn't late and i didn't lack sleep before the show .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: such things happen very rarely to me , and , after many years , the closest thing to solution to this mystery is probably the quality of the film itself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot revolves around two rival chicago reporters - old peter brackett ( nick nolte ) and young , aspiring sabrina peterson ( julia roberts ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: two of them are assigned to cover the train collision .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as soon as they meet , they start scooping each other , but during the process they both discover sinister plot involving cancerogenic milk , and also the romantic feelings they have for each other .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot in this film is rather secondary to its real raison d' ? tre - romantic pairing reminiscent of classical screwball comedies starring spencer tracy and katharine hepburn .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: movie author , director and screenwriter charles shyer , who had some experiences with turning the screwball spirit into modern setting with father of the bride , tries again , this time pairing old nick nolte with young julia roberts .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , although there is some chemistry between the two , soon it stops to arouse any interest .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it probably happens due to poorly executed genre mix , that collides light-hearted romantic comedy with rather uninteresting plot suitable to pure action thrillers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: shyer as director fails to make the proper transition between the two , and fails in both areas , making the story cliched and predictable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the end result is rather forgettable effort , which convinced me not to watch movie again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'll give it the benefit of the doubt , though .
docs.label: negative
